text.text: How do I access the option to post a facility payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: To post a facility payment in ZOLL Billing, you can click Payments > Create a transaction.

text.text: What information do I need to enter when creating a new transaction for posting a facility payment?

text: When creating a new transaction for posting a facility payment, you need to enter the following information: deposit date, transaction amount, payer, transaction type, transaction number.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the deposit date when posting a facility payment?

text: The deposit date is the date the payment will be (or was) deposited to your account. The system will assign the next open period after you post the money back with the original deposit date. If the deposit date is prior to the open period, the money will be placed in an adjustment period.

text.text: What options do I have for selecting the payer when posting a facility payment?

text: You can select the payer by typing the first three characters of the facility name and selecting the name that displays.

text.text: How do I allocate the payment to specific claims when posting a facility payment?

text: To allocate the payment to specific claims, you need to click the Allocate to claims button. The system will pull up the invoices and display them on the page. If the amount you entered exactly matches the charge amount for an invoice, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only. If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display. All claims will be grouped under their associated invoice.

text.text: What happens if the payment amount matches exactly with a single invoice in ZOLL Billing?

text: If the payment amount matches exactly with a single invoice in ZOLL Billing, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle cases where the payment amount exceeds or does not exactly match a single invoice?

text: If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display. All claims will be grouped under their associated invoice.

text.text: Is it possible to remove an invoice from consideration when posting a facility payment? If so, how?

text: If the facility did not pay an invoice, you can remove the invoice from consideration by clicking the Allocate to this invoice button at the top right. The invoice will gray out and all payments will be set to $ 0.00.

text.text: What actions can I take with individual claims within an invoice when posting a facility payment?

text: There are several things you can do with each claim in an invoice: • Full payment: The full amount of the charge was paid • Full denial: If they denied a specific claim within an invoice you can click Full denial • Custom: A window displays under that claim or line item that allows you to enter a custom amount

text.text: What does it mean to mark a claim as "Full denial" when posting a facility payment?

text: When you mark a claim as "Full denial", the payment amount changes to $ 0.00 and the claim's status changes to denial.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of the "Custom" option when allocating payments to claims?

text: The Custom option allows you to enter a custom amount when allocating payments to claims.

text.text: How does the "Ignore" button function when posting a facility payment?

text: The Ignore button ignores the claim on an invoice. The charge and new balance remain the same.

text.text: What happens when the transaction amount matches the allocated line items in ZOLL Billing?

text: If the transaction amount matches the charge amount for an invoice, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only. If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display.

text.text: How can I ensure that all necessary payments are properly allocated before posting a facility transaction?

text: You will need to go through each invoice and decide if all claims within the invoice was paid. There are several things you can do with each claim in an invoice: Full payment: The full amount of the charge was paid. Full denial: If they denied a specific claim within an invoice you can click Full denial. The payment amount changes to $0.00 and the claim's status changes to denial.

text.text: Are there any indicators that help me identify when I can proceed to post a transaction for facility payments?

text: When you can proceed to post a transaction for facility payments depends on the amount of the transaction. If the amount you entered exactly matches the charge amount for an invoice, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only. If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display.

text.text: What does the green bar at the bottom signify when posting a facility payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: The green bar at the bottom of the screen signifies that the transaction has been posted.

text.text: Can you clarify the process for undoing actions or making adjustments before finalizing a facility payment transaction?

text: To reverse a transaction, you must first reverse the refund on the Claim page and then reverse the transaction. You can reverse a transaction because of insufficient funds, stopped payment, if it was posted in error.

text.text: Is there any option to review or verify the allocated payments before posting a transaction in Zoll Billing?

text: If you don't know the claim number, you can click the search icon and enter the customer's name and service date. Once you enter the claim number, the information for the claim displays. If this information is correct, scroll down to the bottom and look at the Unallocated field. This field should read 0.00. If it is not zero, you must reconcile the difference.

text.text: Are there any limitations or restrictions on the actions I can take while allocating payments to claims?

text: If the amount you entered exactly matches the charge amount for an invoice, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only. If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display.
